barbells.name: Standard Barbell
barbells.description: This is the most commonly used barbell in gyms, suited for squats, deadlifts, bench press, etc. It typically has a diameter of 28-29mm and is compatible with Olympic-sized plates.

barbells.name: Olympic Barbell (20kg)
barbells.description: Used in Olympic weightlifting for movements like the snatch and clean & jerk. This bar is heavier and longer compared to other variations.

barbells.name: Olympic Barbell (15kg)
barbells.description: Used in Olympic weightlifting for movements like the snatch and clean & jerk. This bar is lighter and shorter compared to other variations.

barbells.name: EZ Curl Bar
barbells.description: A shorter bar with a zigzag shape designed to reduce stress on the wrists during bicep curls and triceps exercises.

barbells.name: Powerlifting Barbell
barbells.description: Specifically designed for powerlifting exercises (squat, bench press, and deadlift), these bars are stiffer to reduce whip and improve stability during heavy lifts.

barbells.name: Deadlift Bar
barbells.description: Designed specifically for deadlifting, with a longer length and more flex (whip) to assist with pulling heavy loads off the floor.
